intro: Seriphidium stenocephalum, commonly known as the narrow-headed tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by pale褐色 bracts, and it has a compact, bushy growth habit. Seriphidium stenocephalum is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas.
